basic_data.name: 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa
basic_data.priceRange: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

description: Inspired by the life and passions of one man and featuring a touch of the roaring twenties, 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa offers luxurious rooms and suites in the central city of Sliema. The hotel is located 200 meters from the seafront and also offers a splendid 1926 La Plage Beach Club on the water’s edge as well as a luxury SPA. The beach club is located 200 meters away from the hotel and is a seasonal operation. Our concept of ‘Lean Luxury’ includes the following: • Luxury rooms at affordable prices • Uncomplicated comfort and a great sleep • Smart design technology • Raindance showerheads • Flat screens • SuitePad Tablets • Self check in and check out (if desired) • Coffee & tea making facilities

reviews.title: A wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: Staff are particularly good, always pleasant and extremely helpful. Clean, comfortable rooms and we had a sea view as the room was on the ninth floor. Beach club was great with comfortable sun beds and direct sea access. Free vintage bus tour of Malta sights an added bonus. Thank you.

reviews.title: terrible experience
reviews.text: A truly appalling experience. The hotel caught fire in the middle of the night — frightening enough on its own — but what made everything worse was the behavior of Duty Manager Philip. Instead of showing responsibility or basic respect, he was dismissive, arrogant, and completely unhelpful. We were first told our belongings could be collected, but after traveling all the way back, Philip coldly claimed there was nothing. No apology, no empathy, just wasted time and added stress.⚠️ Tip for future travelers: If you ever stay here, be prepared for management that shows zero accountability or respect toward guests. In emergencies, you will not get honesty, clarity, or basic courtesy.

reviews.title: Absolutely terrible experience: Fire and Irresponsible Deputy Manager
reviews.text: Absolutely terrible experience. The hotel caught fire in the middle of the night, which was already frightening enough. To make matters worse, Deputy Manager Philip completely shirked responsibility afterwards. We went all the way back to the hotel to collect our belongings because we were told they were available, but when we arrived, Philip told us there was nothing, wasting our time and leaving us extremely frustrated. This lack of honesty and accountability is unacceptable. Very disappointed and angry with how the situation was handled.

reviews.title: 1926 makes up for a very modern experience perfect for couples
reviews.text: We stayed here during our vacation in July. The service of the personnel made our stay a treat. The room was perfect, and spaceful.

reviews.title: Perfect stay in Sliema
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely amazing. They had everything we needed on the property, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the restaurants were great. The amount of things you get out of a stay here, it is like a resort. It is very much worth what it costs, which is very affordable for everything you get in my opinion. They upgraded us when we got there free of cost. The room was immaculately clean and they came and cleaned early when we weren’t there. They helped up get a ride to the airport early in the morning. The pools are spectacular. It’s near a lot of restaurants and grocery stores, and is just a 5 minute walk from the Valletta ferry. I would stay here again in a heart beat it was truly one of the best hotels we have stayed at.

reviews.title: Family holiday
reviews.text: The staff were excellent, very accommodating and supportive. Access to the spa was a great treat to relax and cool off after a day sightseeing or at the Hotels beach club. Beach club and roof top pool & cabanas are fantastic amenities. Choice of dishes for breakfast was super.Minor note - The App is a great idea although completing bookings was a challenge however the reception team supported this. Book early to secure places on trips and the rooftop pool amenities

Excellent Hotel and great staff. Nice size standard  room. Small balcony but didn’t use much and a bit overlooked but not an issue to us. Great breakfast selection with both British and continental. Excellent cocktails especially the Pina Colada’s. Super friendly bar man!  They also have a happy hour 2-1 cocktails most evenings. Lovely roof top pool with loungers and gazebos but has to be booked in Advance. Best part for us was the beach club a short walk down the street. Wonderful pool! Plenty of loungers. Not too overcrowded. Even had steps at the side of the pool into the sea so you could take a dip. Beach club - No cost to hotel guests apart from food and drink but reasonable prices and v good food. Beach towels available. Overall great holiday and would go back again. Thank you 1926.

reviews.title: Bad experience flee!
reviews.text: Bad experience first time in superior category hotel that you are without hot water for two daysI booked a 4 night stay at Hotel 1926 Le Soleil and on the second evening we are still without hot water in the room. Despite repeated reports, the problem has not been solved and no one offered a real solution or a minimal gesture of courtesy, resulting in deciding to wash with cold water or not to wash.Tiny room, but the price absolutely not: over € 200 per night for a Service that to define disappointing is little.I expected a very different level from a hotel in this category. I would not recommend and will not return.

reviews.title: Perfect stay!
reviews.text: Everything i have to say about this hotel is positive! From the friendly/helpful staff, to the complimentary sunset cruise. Perfect hotel for couples, lovely and modern but tasteful decor throughout. Beach club literally is a 2 min walk away and has a great atmosphere. We ate there twice, both times we were blown away by the food. Rooftop pool is so very chilled and immaculately clean...be sure to reserve beds. The online app makes your stay really seamless. We booked our airport taxi (€20) via this and reserved sunbeds and made dinner reservations. Breakfast was fresh and delicious every day. Never too busy. Water taxi return to Valletta, for 2 was €9 and takes less than 10 mins. Honestly, one of the best hotels we've stayed in. Thank you.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the best location in Malta
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with reception and other very beautiful dependencies. Great maintenance, impeccable cleaning and very kind staff. Located 150mt from the ferry to Valeta, descending a light slope. It has a spa with included access (part treatments) in the same building, a very well equipped gym right in front with also included access and a great beach club about 150mts from the hotel (functioning only in the warmer months). On the rooftop there is a terrace with swimming pool, sun loungers and couples' cabins, and reservation (free) is required in advance. Rooms and spacious bathrooms. I stayed in a room with a balcony with 2 chairs and noise-proof door, which ensures a peaceful sleep, even though the place is quiet.The room has a very comfortable king-size bed, a sofa bed with TV in front but sideways to the bed. There is a desk with chair and center table. 2-door cabinet with safe. The box is wide and has good water flow. The wi-fi signal is strong and very fast. The breakfast is rich, varied and all very tasty.It is a great choice in the best location of Malta (Sliema), away from the nightly bustle of St. Julians and the moisture of Valeta, but close to both.

reviews.title: 4 days of relaxation
reviews.text: Hotel located in Sliema. Great location for various directions and proximity to the main street. Very comfortable superior room, bathrobe, slippers and Nespresso coffee machine very welcome. Indoor pool with spa and outdoor heated rooftop. Great breakfast. All the very kind staff, for me in particular a thank you to Dayana for the various info she gave us and congratulations to the bar man Kumar. Definitely will be back

reviews.title: Beautiful, but unacceptably noisy.
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was a beautiful hotel, no doubts, and staff were generally friendly. HOWEVER, and this is a big however. The noise levels are obscene. We have never stayed in hotels with such thin walls. We could hear every phone call, every step in rooms above us, and even so much as the toilets flushing in the room next door. We were also placed next to the lift (409) and had constant noise from this to add to it. In addition, there is awful building works going on across the road (less than 10m away). This was obscenely loud and went on from very early on until fairly late. So, you have constant noise. We raised this and was told the manager would contact us “if there was an issue that existed”, but never said anything. This is poor as there is no way they are unaware of the issues. Other guests also complained about the same thing. Therefore, despite the lovely amenities, I would absolutely NOT reccomend staying in this hotel because of the noise and the poor way management dealt with it. Had we been booked in for longer, we likely would’ve cancelled this.

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.text: Amazing hotel. Booked for location and Spa but would highly recommend to anyone visiting Malta. Staff have been great, always smiling and willing to help. The little extras from free trips, chocolates at night to complimentary drinks have all been super kind. Can’t fault any part of this trip

reviews.title: Exceptional hotel in the heart of Sliema
reviews.text: A wonderful hotel with professional and friendly staff. Delicious breakfast with quality produce and great choice (the prosecco was a lovely touch). The rooftop pool and it's luxurious terrace are a lovely addition and the mulled wine by the pool was a great treat.

reviews.title: Hôtel *****
reviews.text: I recommend the Hotel spotless cleanliness, more-than-perfect room comfort, very friendly staff, daily accessible spa, breakfast and buffet with choice, we were upgraded without even asking, bed decoration for my daughter's 18th birthday.I thank all the team

reviews.title: A good family holiday!
reviews.text: An extended family weekend at this half board hotel!A warm and very professional welcome!A very nice environment with a spa an indoor pool. The rooms are very good impeccable bedding, perfect cleanliness.Breakfast is very good, with a staff with little care! Nillu is absolutely very attentive with his team, the quality is very good!We had dinner on the last night and the different dishes we tasted were excellent accompanied by a good Maltese red wine!Thanks again to the entire 1926 team!Go ahead with your eyes closed you will be delighted!

reviews.title: exceptional stay!
reviews.text: My stay at this hotel was truly exceptional. The staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive, making me feel at home from the moment I arrived. The property itself was spotlessly clean, reflecting a high standard of care and maintenance. What stood out the most, however, was the hotel’s strong commitment to sustainability. From eco-friendly initiatives to thoughtful environmental practices, their dedication to ecological responsibility was truly impressive. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing, responsible, and memorable stay.

reviews.title: The perfect hotel
reviews.text: We travel a lot, and have rarely seen such an example of hospitality, from complimentary taxi from airport to hotel, beautiful and always smiling receptionists, lovely waiters and housekeepers, we loved it all!! If you're looking for a perfect hotel to stay in, please book this one!Thank you very much once again from Bruna  and Ivan!! ❤

reviews.title: Nice and clean place in great location!
reviews.text: Great clean hotel in a good location in Sliema! Rooms and bathrooms are clean, very good breakfast, nice and courteous staff! Location: 2min. from sea, 5min. to town with many shops, bars and restaurants. Also the ferry to Valetta, Gozo, Comino etc. is only about 5min away!

reviews.title: BOOK THIS PLACE!!
reviews.text: This review is late, but very very needed. I LOVE THIS HOTEL... I don't care what any other review says, this is the best hotel in Malta, in fact, when I come back I will only stay at 1926. From the second I arrived to the airport I was greeted with such hospitality by my driver who picked me and took me to the hotel. When I checked in I met Christian and Alex who were both so warm and welcoming. I was in love with the vibe of the hotel  from the second I walked in -- the glass of prosseco also didn't hurt. I was really happy when I checked in as they gave me a free upgrade to one of their suites which was fit for a queen. This hotel is beyond amazing, they offer FREE tours and shuttles for all guest, every day, and had a beautiful turn down service every night. I came in decemebr so the beach club was closed, but the spa pool and sauna honestly made me not miss it. One of my favorite parts of this hotel is the fine dining restaurant they have on the top floor, somiler Bryan was so amazing and knowledgable on his wines that it changed how I drink wine. And the chef and his team, the food was outstanding, I did the chef's course with the wine paring.. i don't remember nor care how much it costs, the experience was well worth the value. I cannot talk about this place without mentioning some of the managers and "executives" of the place, especially Sascha the COO who I met with another exect [sorry I did not catch her name] on my last night during their canapie night. Typically when you meet these type of people they are very stush and closed off. But its truly not the case with this team, while I am sure I talked their ear off, they were all so friendly and hosptiable. I love this hotel so much, that it has been almost 2 months and I still have the app on my phone, and cannot get myself to delete it. I was sad when I checked out of this place, as it quickly became my home in Matla. I absolutely love this hotel.PS. i know there were some comments about the construction outside, but the island has been in construction for 20 years. There were some workers outside of my window, and I didn't find them disturbing one bit. In fact, I enjoyed waving to them in the mornings as I sat for my morning tea. The noise was very low and I often didn't hear them. Plus if you are visiting Malta, you should be outside not inside ... so the construction shouldn't both you one bit. Again, I love this place and look forward to booking my next stay upon my next visit to Malta.

reviews.title: Cozy hotel
reviews.text: Good hotel located in Sliema, five minutes by boat from the valley Friendly staff, hearty and varied breakfast.Improved some aspects of the rooms such as hygienic devices conditioner, cream, maintenance bathroom doors. Some towels were stained.Overall good experience

reviews.title: Exceptional Stay at 1926 Le Soleil: Spontaneous Booking Turned Into a Memorable Luxury Experienc
reviews.text: We booked 1926 Le Soleil spontaneously while already in Malta and unfortunately encountered a bit of a booking issue at the beginning. However, this was resolved in the most professional and heartfelt way by the hotel manager, Olga, whom we would like to especially commend. Thanks to her, we received a fantastic upgrade to the “Sunny Suite” with a corner balcony and beautiful sea view – truly one of the highlights of our trip.The hotel itself is full of thoughtful features: the rooftop pool with heated water and the most comfortable loungers we’ve ever experienced offered true relaxation. The indoor pool, sauna, steam bath, and modern gym provide a top-level wellness experience.The in-house restaurant “Margaux” is also highly recommended – the food is delicious, especially the steaks, and the prices are very fair for the quality offered.A minor downside was that the air conditioning was still on winter mode during our stay in April. Since opening the windows brings in mosquitoes (which can lead to restless nights), we were provided with a state-of-the-art fan, which worked perfectly – an innovative and effective solution.The staff throughout the hotel were extremely friendly, attentive, and always happy to help – we truly felt welcomed and well taken care of.The location is also ideal: right by the Tigné Point promenade, close to shopping and with easy access to the ferry to Valletta – great for both exploring and relaxing.All in all, we had a wonderful and memorable holiday full of comfort, good food, and amazing service. We’ll definitely be back!

reviews.title: Little privacy and a construction site close to the hotel
reviews.text: Some important details for those who are preparing to book this hotel. The hotel is located in a position set back from the sea, the photos of the beach club suggest it is facing the sea, instead it is located in a narrow alley a few minutes walk from the sea. The main flaw, incorrectly not reported on the hotel website, is that close to the structure there is a very noisy construction site in full swing (Saturday and Sunday included), so forget about a good sleep and privacy. The structure is quite modern, small rooms and not soundproofed, so beyond the yard you hear the noise of the other rooms, the corridor, etc .. I point out that the hotel bar closes at 11pm, and even if you are sitting down to drink a cocktail you turn off the lights:-) , just to invite you to go to sleep. I confirm, like other reviews, that the breakfast is high quality, machines to serve with Lavazza coffee, good choice of sweet and savory, fresh juice, fruit, yogurt. Beautiful rooftop terrace with a small sea view pool and restaurant (not tried). Overall I was not convinced, I would not go back.

reviews.title: Great hotel and staff very pleasant stay !! 100% recommend
reviews.text: We visited in April ,hotel and staff are all amazing !! Our waiters Denish and Suzanne was great ,very helpful,he arranged for me to get a happy birthday song from all waiters and a cake with a sparkler!!  Suzanne arranged for us to get poached eggs for breakfast which is not on menu !! No extras charges!! You won’t go wrong with this hotel so helpful and such a pleasant stay!!Dear ben c,Thank you for choosing 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa!It brings us immense joy to read such a positive review about your stay with us in April. It's delightful to know that you found our staff, especially Denish and Suzanne, to be so helpful and accommodating. Their commitment to service is indeed a reflection of our hotel's philosophy.Your mention of the special birthday celebration arranged by our team and the personalised breakfast experience is particularly heartwarming. It's these moments that we strive to create for all our guests. We hope that your pleasant experience will bring you back to us!Best Regards,Giorgia F.Hospitality Team1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Honest review
reviews.text: I feel very disappointed after staying here for 3 nights and I can completely agree with the others who state that they have been mislead. The hotel is not on the seafront, not like the pictures advertised of the beach club. The hotel entrance is down a side street a few streets back from the sea front. The room we had was upgraded to a superior double. I would have expected a normal double to be of this size and standard in a 4 star hotel. It was basic however, on the plus side, the bed was big and comfy. The room was cleaned daily and we got fresh towels when we requested them.There was a selection of items at breakfast - cooked and continental which were regularly topped up. The orange juice was fresh and they had a selection of fresh fruit too.The bar served a large selection of premium drinks and the cocktails looked nice and good value with a happy hour. There was building work going on outside the hotel which was noisy but I think it could have been worse if we were on a lower level floor. The spa was a big let down, there was about 4 loungers and a few hard chairs. There was only one jet in the hydro pool which worked as the other two were broken. The sauna and steam room were small but adequate. The whole spa needs a massive revamp, it looks a bit grubby especially around the pool area. Don’t believe the reviews about Prosecco on arrival as the hotel does not offer this.The location of the hotel is good for catching the ferry to Valletta but overall, I think there is other hotels in the area which are more premium class for around the same price.

reviews.title: Superb hotel❤️
reviews.text: Visited last October and had an amazing time! Le soleil has everything you need from the hotel.Staff were so nice, professional and welcoming, they are the pride of the hotel!❤️Food in the beach club - delicious and always fresh. Rooms - spacious, serene. Everything, from pools and sun loungers to rooms was sparkling clean. Indoor pool with bubbles - therapeutic! The rooftop pool had best loungers I've ever came acrossMalta is a place to fall in love with and Im already planning to return this autumn.Dear Pola F,Thank you for choosing our 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa!Your glowing remarks about Le Soleil truly made our day! It's wonderful to hear that our diligent team managed to exceed your expectations and contribute to your memorable stay. The fact that our food and amenities, particularly the indoor pool, caught your attention, is equally pleasing. Maintaining the highest standard of cleanliness is indeed a priority for us, so your comments in this regard are much appreciated. As for the rooftop pool loungers, we're delighted they stood out amongst your experiences in Malta. We look forward to welcoming you back this autumn for another splendid stay. Best Regards,Giorgia F.Hospitality Team1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Avoid – Disappointing and Misleading Experience
reviews.text: Our stay was incredibly disappointing, starting with the outrageous noise from building works right next door. The “junior suite” turned out to be just a standard, basic room—nothing “suite” about it.We dined at Restaurant Margaux and honestly, the food was utterly mediocre. The so-called spa? Don’t be fooled. It’s just a pool—no functioning jets, no hot tub, and the steam room wasn’t working properly either.To top it all off, the hotel claims the key code access system is “convenient”—ours worked once during the entire stay. We had to share a single physical key between us, which had the room number written on the key chain. Seriously unsafe if you happen to misplace it.All in all, poor communication, false advertising, and a total lack of value for the money. Would not recommend.

reviews.title: Great 4 Night City Break
reviews.text: The 1926 Hotel is a quietly confident 5 star hotel in a great location within the town. Has Great SPA facilities and a Michelin star restaurant located on the roof/top floor. With Great views. Easy walking distance to the Harbour front, and access to the main ferry across to Valetta. The various staff couldn’t have been more helpful, professional and friendly. Well worth a visit!.Dear Atky803,Thank you for choosing 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa!Your generous words are truly heartening. The 1926 Hotel and its team are thrilled to learn that your stay was marked by the quiet confidence of our property and the convenience of our location. We're delighted that you enjoyed our spa facilities and the gastronomical delights of our Le GV Michelin-starred restaurant, all while being treated to splendid views.The proximity to the harbour and easy ferry access to Valetta is indeed a unique feature that our guests find beneficial. We're elated that this added to the pleasure of your visit.The true essence of hospitality lies in the dedication and friendliness of the staff. Learning that our team left a positive impression on you reaffirms our commitment to delivering exceptional service. Your endorsement is hugely appreciated and we hope to welcome you back for another delightful experience at the 1926 Hotel.Best Regards,Giorgia F.Hospitality Team1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: The indoor climate!
reviews.text: They are not serviceminded at all on this hotel. Indoor climate poor, it smells cleaning stuff. I have stayed many times at this hotel, but in the reception you get no help in its out of giving map advice. Dont take this hotel! Needed to sleep with balvony door open.

reviews.title: Maltese may be the best
reviews.text: Because it’s winter season, we didn’t take advantage of the hotel’s pool beach and facilities. We had a great time though. Must come in summer. Excellent hotel. The location, cleanliness, amenities, all the details in the rooms, the remaining customer profile, breakfast, the staff are all excellent. Exceptional price performance.Dear guest,Thank you for choosing our 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & SpaYour warm words of appreciation bring immense joy to our hearts. It's indeed a delight to hear about your experience at our hotel, even during the winter season. Our commitment to maintaining the highest standards in cleanliness, facilities, and service is unwavering, and we are pleased to know that you observed these aspects. Your commendation of our location, room details and customer profile is also greatly appreciated. We take pride in delivering an experience that matches the value for money.It would be our pleasure to welcome you back during the summer season, where you will get to enjoy our pool, beach and other facilities to the fullest. Best regards,Giorgia F.Hospitality Team1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Great Choice Despite Minor Issues
reviews.text: Overall very pleased we spent a week at this hotel. The location is ideal with easy walking to the shops, restaurants and ferries. The staff at reception were always attentive and friendly. The breakfast had a large selection and of good quality, I liked the fact you were greeted on entry and advised which table to use rather than wandering around trying to find one. We rarely had to wait for the lift. I was amazed that a complimentary tour was available in a historic bus with a trip to the Blue Grotto, Dingli Cliffs and Mdina. The beachside club was excellent apart from one staff member who was aggressive and rude when we had the temerity to drink water from a bottle not purchased at the facility, we didn’t know the rule but the message should have been delivered in a different manner. The bedroom furniture was far from standard and ideal with no wardrobes or drawers to put things away. A poorly thought out choice. There was lots of noise from very early in the morning from the updating of the building opposite including, contrary to my travel company info, Sunday. Ear plugs certainly helped and as we were advised before going it didn’t bother me as out all day. I recommend two trips, the Tuk Tuk tour of Gozo was awesome and you were picked up close to the hotel and The Sunset Cruise to the Blue Lagoon by Hornblower Cruises, much quieter at this time and sunset fantastic. Uber rides are inexpensive compared with the UK and if travelling with Jet2 I would forget the arranged transport (arrived early and got us to the airport too soon after lots of pickups on the way and terrible attitude) and go by Uber or Bolt. Overall loved our holiday in Sliema and very pleased I chose this hotel.

reviews.title: Wow, just wow
reviews.text: What an exceptional hotel. This should definitely be a 5* hotel. From the moment we arrived we just knew this was going to be special. Cold water on arrival. Check in with Francesca was quick and easy with everything explained. No room key, access to room is keypad which is a great idea. The room (Premium suite) was simply stunning, bright, spacious and relaxing. Incredible views of the sea from the balcony.Every single member of the hotel staff were so friendly, attentive and would do anything they could for you, even making sure you had cool water in your room fridge. Rooftop pool was amazing, although getting into warm water for a swim was a little shock (it’s heated only by the sun). You don’t have to leave your sun bed for drinks or food, simply scan the code on your table to order and it arrives. The beach club/infinity pool is not attached to the hotel, it’s across the road off the promenade. It too is stunning, cold and refreshing with unbelievable views across the sea. Spent many hours in the water watching the cruise ships coming in and out. Again, staff here were amazing, attentive and very friendly. I have booked to come back already.

reviews.title: Clean and comfortable with excellent service
reviews.text: We booked a Junior Suite. Our arrival was all very courteous and pleased to find we had a 10th floor room which gave us panoramic and sea views which we had not completely expected. We had a balcony, plenty long enough, but only around 2ft wide, and no room to walk past  one of the small chairs. There is so much building work going on in the vicinity, I counted 40 tower cranes from our balcony, but work does not start until after 8am and finishes no later than 6pm, so no unwelcome disturbance. We used the roof top pool, although the booking system was not very efficient for this, and everything in the hotel is booked on their app, which they help you set up on your phone when you check in. The roof top pool is quiet, only around a dozen sunbeds, but they are fabulous and comfy and plenty of parasols which staff are happy to put up and adjust for you. Despite the booking system making it appear fully booked, when we were there on 3 occasions , there were no more than 4 other guests. The downside - the pool was too shallow to swim in, and if you want to cool down after roasting in the sun, use the shower, the pool is far too hot, like bath water.We also used the hotel's private water front pool, bar and sunbed area. The pool was great, able to manage a little swim, and  perfect temperature. Sunbeds were good, and parasols again put up by staff. It was much more congested down here , no need to book, just turn up and towels provided. Drinks available any time, just catch the waiter's eyes. Disappointed not to be able to bring own water, it had to be bought from the bar, no outside food or drink could be brought in. My big gripe was loud club disco music - it is not a club 18-30s hotel so why play loud thumping bass rubbish. Fortunately a couple of visits to Le Plage area they had someone playing the music quieter, and although not an Abba aficionado, hearing 4 of their songs in an hour was a distinct improvement.Breakfast was a good spread, with English cooked breakfast, continental meats and cheeses, fruit yoghurts, a choice of pastries and various teas and coffees from a machine. We only had one lunch, taken down at Le Plage, a decent enough burger and chips.Room was spacious, bed and pillows comfortable, a good size wardrobe, with iron and board, we had to ask for more hangers, but ended not unpacking our bags because there was not a single drawer - very disappointing. There was a room safe, and the room was cleaned daily, and also an early evening visit to top up on the complimentary tea and nespresso machine. One complimentary daily bottle of water as tap water not considered good for English palate. air conditioning worked well and not too noisy. Nice big shower, but I dont think the guys that installed it, put on a big enough slope, as I ended having to squeegee the water into the drain with my feet after the shower.We had a great complimentary bus tour visiting 3 locations on the island on a 1960's vintage bus, I was a little disappointed it was not the older vintage bus shown on their promotional pics, but you cant complain about free. I was disappointed that the night after was arrived there was also a free sunset cruise round Valletta harbour, which we were not made aware of, and the reception staff indicated it runs on a Wednesday - however after looking for it on their app it did not appear, and it was only the day before the reception staff told us it was not running that week. So we ended up booking one of the trips through VisitMalta.com.We booked a taxi through the hotel back to the airport, very clean, on time and cost Eur23 for the two of us.At round £200 per night with breakfast it was pricey, and I guess we got what we paid for. I have to admit  that paying that much, I was expecting a more usable balcony, drawers in the room, a less rowdy pool by the sea, and to be able to use water from the room or elsewhere by the pool, and not to have to pay Eur3 for a small bottle. I thought also to qualify as a suite it would be more than an ensuite room with a skinny balcony. On the plus side, there was the complimentary tour, and a panoramic view. Decent location near bus stops and Sliema Ferries with plenty of local restaurants and close to 2 shopping precincts.

reviews.title: A fantastic last minute find.
reviews.text: Two couples late forties & mid fifties made the crazy mistake of booking a hotel in the clubbing heart of St Julians.Thankfully a bit of research found availability at 1926 Le Soleil Hotel.Yes there’s negative reviews which very nearly put us off & yes there’s a building site either side (let’s be honest where’s not having building work done in Malta)From arrival, to the delightful lady checking us in to the rooftop pool staff & beach club staff it was all perfect.It’s a great location & somewhere I’d highly recommend coming too.We loved it.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in Sliema
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with breakfast included. Definitely some details to improve in the rooms because they are not really 4 star hotels, but overall great!The really superlative breakfast with a wide choice for all palates and the pools of the structure are both fabulous, both on the roof and by the sea.Staff really nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.title: Top to be
reviews.text: Hotel that has all the right cards to be at the top: location in Sliema, modern and well-kept style, rooms equipped with all the necessary comforts, customer care, great breakfast, spa and swimming pools. We very much enjoyed the aperitif offered on the terrace. I was sorry, however, to note that sometimes the customer is considered only as a tourist. Not being able to access the starred restaurant on the terrace (it does not accept children) we had dinner, on their advice, in the one on the beach / solarium. Spectacular view, bad food, to pass on to the typical tourist. Having to leave very early we were offered the possibility, first, of a takeaway breakfast (since we had paid for it with the room), then, of something quick to consume at the counter (a coffee and some croissants). Result: no coffee (machine in the breakfast room still off) a plate with mini croissants and leftover cake from the day before that, of course, we refused. Fortunately, a nespresso machine with pods was available in the room. Unable to book a Bolt taxi from our phone, we ask the reception to do it for us the night before, so we don't have problems early in the morning. A taxi arrives without signs, without a taximeter, with a driver who does not remember where he must take us and to whom we must give directions. In the end he asks us 28€, against the 10€ paid on the way (Bolt would have asked 8€ for the same route). I hope you can improve these aspects and be in every way the 4 stars you expect.

reviews.title: If you like relaxing between construction sites, this is the place for you
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice lobby, but this is just a facade. The room was furnished with what looked like the cheapest office furniture they could find. Our room was dark and a bit on the damp side. While it did have an A/C controller, it didn't actually do anything. During meal times the room also filled with the smell of whatever is being cooked.As the hotel butts up against the adjacent building you have a lovely view into someone's home, (the alternative being a room on the front which suffers from high noise volumes and dirt from the construction site opposite). No sunlight penetrates the room and you need to go outside and look up to see if it's a sunny day.Staff were cheerful and pleasant, but with a few exceptions (concierge guy was very good) generally useless. One example of manyeach day we asked: Can I have some normal tea in my room as the cleaner only leaves flavoured bags each day? Each day the answer was: Yes, no problem sir, we'll bring some up. Each day nothing arrived The rooftop bar/pool area is very noisy from the construction site and rather small and the beach club down the hill and across the main road is also next to a construction site. All round this is a very disappointing hotel seeking maximum payments for minimum service and standards. To give you an idea, this is one or may even two levels down from a Premier Inn

reviews.title: Good hotel - with air up
reviews.text: We can recommend the hotel only conditionally. For us, the price / performance ratio did not match - a pity. Rooms: clean and neatly equipped. There is no proper storage in the bathroom. Breakfast: Good selection of who comes after 9:00 am may have to wait for a seat. It's a little impersonal.Pool & beach club: really great! Here you can relax super. Attention: Pool must be reserved online. The location of the hotel is good and you can reach everything on the island great by bus. All in all, a good hotel, but there is still potential for improvement at the 4* standard.

reviews.title: Underwhelming!! Stay elsewhere!
reviews.text: I’m not sure where to begin… So the Hotel is situated opposite a building site for context. Upon arrival you are met with friendliness and the reception area is modern and well kept. However, our room was not ready and there was no where to wait so we were sent away for 6 hours. After getting up at 3am all we wanted to do was relax but we couldn’t. Not ideal.We had booked what they call a Deluxe Room and for that you get from what I can see a Standard/Premier Room but on a high floor. See photos of said Deluxe Room. This is anything but Deluxe! Very basic, only a rail to hang your clothes, no chest of drawers. Very very basic! Bathroom ok but run down.  Bed hard. Shower weak. We were woken up daily by workmen doing their work right opposite us. Work being a complete build so a lot of noise ! Zero privacy. Zero point in even having a balcony. See photos for the view!You have to reserve your spot on the very small paddling pool on the roof. Very comfy sun loungers but dirty glass around the pool, oh and a bright red crane right over your head as you try to relax. We tried the breakfast, it was good and a lot of choice. We also had treatments which were good. The people in the spa are lovely. It’s because of them I’ve given an extra star.We had a late flight home and like in normal hotels we asked for late check out. Firstly they told me I had to wait till the night before we check out to find out if it’s possible but would be €60. We then enquired and were told the hotel was full. A lie. I checked other sites and there was availability. We were not asking to stay in our room particularly but have somewhere to freshen up before our late flight. We were then told there were rooms but we would have to pay €150. The reception team were very unhelpful but offered to keep our luggage so we had no choice but to wander - again for 6 hours waiting for our pick up. Pool was full. No where to shower or wait. Another long day ahead.During our stay we decided to go to the bar and have a cocktail. We ordered them and there was zero alcohol in the drink! I mentioned this to the bar man who was very offended and reluctantly put a little more in the glass. He also told me they only put 10ml of drink in the cocktail when the standard is much more. A bit of a rip off if you ask me.We were looking forward to seeing the pool by the sea. Well this is not by the hotel. It’s a walk down the hill and along the seafront. Another run down area next to some rocks that they call a private beach. Over all I do not recommend this Hotel. Our little trip was to relax and our experience here was not that. It looks fabulous and lovely in the pictures but it’s not. Ok the reception area is well kept but our room was not and the staff could be vastly improved.There are definitely nicer hotels in Malta and I’m sure are run by people who believe in good service when this hotel did very little.I would say look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Great stay for couples in Malta
reviews.text: We stayed at 1926 for a week over the Easter break, Malta was lovely and we were really lucky with the weather!Location wise the hotel is a short walk from the shops, restaurants and bars in Sliema and also the ferry to Valletta or other day trips, we even strolled up to St Julian’s too. The hotel were really helpful with everything we needed.Room was great and yes there is construction but generally there’s no getting away from it in Malta and didn’t find it bothered us. Being lucky with the weather they did open up the beach club which was a short walk away which provided towels etc and id ideal as there are few sandy beaches. The rooftop pool was also open which had a heated pool, note you have to book this on the app when you arrive as only few spaces but was well worth it and the food was amazing! My biggest feedback was not being able to book the spa (like you can the rooftop) it’s not very big at all and the evening we went it was just full of families with young kids splashing in the pool, even messing about in the steam and sauna and this was just really disappointing/not relaxing and so we avoided it for the rest of the week. Really handy having the usual luggage store and then you can change in the spa changing rooms / freshen up before travelling. Makes for a great base for Malta!
